result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: amended

Pre-trial conference on October 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ma] Cases 20CF371 & 22CF8 called at 9:25am 
Defendant Javin M Vogel in court.  Attorney Tyler A Jochman in court for Javin M Vogel.  Attorney Monica Hall in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Waiver of Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment occur in Case 22CF8:
Mr. Vogel waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

As to Case 22CF8: 
Atty Jochman orally moves for bond modification. 
The Court is unable to confirm what Dodge Co family court orders are.

DA Hall does not object to a modification of bond. 

The Court amends bond to 'not to discuss the facts of the case with S.R.S.'

recess: 9:40am  

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/12/22 at 11:00am    (2) Status Conference on 11/14/22 at 8:30am

[ml] Cases 20CF371 and 22CF8 called at 3:25PM
Defendant Javin M Vogel in court, in custody. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court notes that the Defendant continues to qaulify for the Public Defender's Office, however the Public Defender has yet to find counsel for the Defendant.
The Court sets this matter over for a Status of Counsel. The State and the Defendant do not object.

Scheduling Order
Preliminary hearing on April 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

--no contact with Victim 1
--no presence at Game Stop in Watertown

[ma] Cases 20CF371 & 22CF8 called at 2:12 PM 
Defendant Javin M Vogel appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Cassi Nelson (the PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

Initial Apperance occurs in Case 22CF8
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within the time limit at the request of Defense. 

As to Case 22CF8, the Court requires a $1000  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no contact with Victim 1
--no presence at Game Stop in Watertown 

As to Case 20CF371, the Court requires a $200 CASH bond with conditions as previously ordred. 
recess 2:20pm
